page.title: 14THE QUARRY
page.content: The quarry at Kilmington digs for gravel. Part of the ground is worked out, and a local farmer uses it for grazing. There is also a big pond, which is the result of quarrying. It provides a habitat for a lot of wild life. We have seen rabbits and foxes, and men go there to shoot ducks. Now the quarry is extending further north-east. Different grades of gravel are excavated, from fine to course. The largest stone they have dug up is on display at the gate to the quarry. They produce 2 grades of sand. They import fine pit sand (yellow & white) and blocks 3"to 9". Also they import 2 grades of scalpings. The company is called E.C.C.(which stands for ENGLISH CHINA CLAY). ECC have many quarries. The head office is at Exeter.
